 > Find the driving point impedance seen by the voltage source in Figure P11–7 and the voltage transfer function. T_V(s) = V_2(s)/V_1(s).


### Driving point impedans

 Da det er en operationsforstærker, antages det at denne er idéel og dermed er $\boxed{Z_{in} =\infty}$.


### Transfer function.

Det er en non-inverterende opstilling - derfor gælder flg.:

$$
T_V(s) = \frac{Z_1+Z_2}{Z_2}
$$
Hvor:
$$
Z_1 = 2R \quad Z_2 = 2R||C
$$
$$
Z_2 = \frac{2R \cdot \frac{1}{Cs}}{2R+\frac{1}{Cs}}
$$
Derfor:
$$
T_V(s)=\frac{2R+\frac{2R\frac{1}{Cs}}{2R+\frac{1}{Cs}}}{\frac{2R\frac{1}{Cs}}{2R+\frac{1}{Cs}}}
$$

Omskrevet:
$$
\boxed{
T_V(s)=2RCs+2
}
$$

Med værdierne: $R = 100\;\mathrm{\Omega} \quad C = 0.01\mathrm{µF}$:

```{r, echo=FALSE}
expr <- function(s) 2*100*0.01e-6*s+2
x_zero <- c(-1/(2*0.01e-6*100))
y_zero <- c(0)
x_pole <- c(0)
y_pole <- c(0)
pole_zero_plot(x_zero, y_zero, x_pole, y_pole, 500*sqrt(3)+20,expr, exprrange = 0.1,exprmin = 0.00005)
```
